meanings.definition: The beginning or introductory part of a discourse or composition.
meanings.sent1: The exordiums of the story set the stage for what was to come.
meanings.sent2: She always struggled with writing the exordiums of her essays.
meanings.sent3: The exordiums of the speech were so boring that everyone fell asleep.
meanings.sent4: His exordiums were like a bright light leading the way through the darkness of his writing.
meanings.sent5: The exordiums of the play were so captivating that the audience was immediately drawn in.

meanings.sent1: The exordiums of the contract outlined the main points to be discussed.
meanings.sent2: The exordiums of the meeting were brief and to the point.
meanings.sent3: His exordiums were so long-winded that everyone lost interest before he got to the main topic.
meanings.sent4: The exordiums of the book were like a key unlocking the mysteries within.
meanings.sent5: The exordiums of the presentation were so engaging that everyone was eager to hear more.
